page.title: 05MOVING INTO LOCAL VILLAGES
page.content: Most people moved to Ailsworth because of the pleasant countryside and peaceful atmosphere and because it is close to the growing large city of Peterborough. Many people moved to the area between five and fifteen years ago when a new estate was built. This of course enlarged the growing community. Ailsworth remains one of the more popular villages on the west side of Peterborough. On the other hand Stibbington is a much smaller village where most of the residents were born and will die. Though located beside the A1 it is less accessible from Peterborough than Ailsworth so it is less popular with commuters. Sutton and Waternewton both contain many long-established residents with a few new comers who have bought up properties as they have become vacant.
